submission:
```python
Peter has an n sided die and Colin has an m sided die If they both roll their dice at the same time return the probability that Peter rolls strictly higher than Colin
def my_func(input1:int, input2:int):
            """Alter this python function "my_func" to accept inputs containing             2 integers in [1, 1000]. The function should output a float.            Only use base python functions and do not import any packages.            Do not include print statements, unit tests, in-line comments or            multi-line comments."""```
response:
```python
def my_func(input1: int, input2: int) -> float:
    total_outcomes = input1 * input2
    favorable_outcomes = sum((input1 - i) for i in range(1, input2 + 1) if input1 > i)
    return favorable_outcomes / total_outcomes
```
